revised_title: DITE Tokamak Experiment: Plasma Containment, Purity Control, and Neutral Beam Heating
tldr: The DITE tokamak experiment at Culham Laboratory explores plasma containment, purity control, and neutral beam heating in a toroidal configuration. The unique bundle divertor prototype demonstrates improved containment and reduced impurities, while neutral injection heating delivers power to the plasma, enhancing containment time and performance. These findings contribute to the development of future fusion reactors.
